episode_summary: With guest Adam Chase and co-host Anne Miller, the team discuss China’s intentionally skewed digital maps, Germany’s unreliable train announcements and delays, marathon oddities including women’s urinals that speed up pit stops, and the decades-long mystery of the Masquerade golden hare that Dan claims to know the whereabouts of. Along the way they swap mapping, transit, and treasure-hunt anecdotes.

facts.fact: My fact is that every map of China is a little bit wrong.
And my fact is that German train station Tanois are so bad that an idiom for I don't understand in Germany is if for Steyer nor Bonhoff or I only understand train station.
Okay, my fact this week is that female London marathon runners are 20% slower than Boston marathon runners. But they urinate 170% quicker.
My fact this week is that there is a hair that has been missing for 40 years. But I know where it is.
